IScene Interface Reference
[SCENE+ Module]

import "sceneplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IScene:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

SCENE+ Main Scene Object.

The top object in the FreeWill+ object hierarchy and the primary rendering goal. The scene is invisible by itself but constitutes an additional top level that hosts all the objects that subject to or take part in the rendering process (see ISceneObject, ISceneCamera, ISceneLight).

To be functional the Scene must obtain a pointer to the Renderer Object (IRndrGeneric) - see IScene::PutRenderer and How to Configure a Scene of Animation. The IsReady function (inherited from ISceneRenderee) tests if the Renderer is known.

Being an IKineNode derivative, the Scene usually provides the ultimate root node of the whole kinematical system. However you can use the IKineNode functions to build it, the IScene provides facility functions that not only construct the objects, but also guarantee their proper initialisation.

To render the whole scene, just call the Render function inherited after ISceneRenderee. It will run the Render functions for all the direct child nodes providing they are ISceneRenderee-derived objects. Notice that any Renderees that are not the direct children of the Scene will not be rendered.

See also:
FreeWillPlus::Scene implementation class.

Public Member Functions

Properties
Setting the Renderer is mandatory

HRESULT GetRenderer ([out] IRndrGeneric **)
 Retrieves the Renderer Object.

HRESULT PutRenderer ([in] IRndrGeneric *)
 Sets the Renderer Object.

Scene Meshed Object Facility Functions
These functions create scene objects and put them among its child nodes; necessary initialisation is performed where appropriate.

HRESULT NewObject (FWSTRING pLabel,[out, retval] ISceneObject **)
 Creates a new Scene Meshed Object and calls AddObject.

HRESULT AddObject (FWSTRING pLabel, ISceneObject *)
 Puts the given Scene Meshed Object among the child nodes and initialises it by passing the renderer pointer to ISceneObject::PutRenderer.

HRESULT GetCurrentCamera ([out, retval] ISceneCamera **p)
 Returns the currently active camera (or NULL if unknown);.

HRESULT PutCamera (ISceneCamera *p)
 Acknowledges the object about creation of a new camera; obligatory if there is no camera set as direct child of the Scene object.

HRESULT SortDisplayList ()
 See ISceneRenderee::GetRenderOrdinal for meaning of this function.
